qas.question: What type of ships did the US spend most of its time sinking?
What weapon posed a significant threat to US navy ships?
How many US warships were damaged by gun fire and mines?
Where were the majority of US naval patrols of Korea?

answers.text: the west and east coasts of North Korea

context: During most of the war, the UN navies patrolled <a3_0>the west and east coasts of North Korea<a3_0/>, sinking <a0_0>supply and ammunition ships<a0_0/> and denying the North Koreans the ability to resupply from the sea. Aside from very occasional gunfire from North Korean shore batteries, the main threat to United States and UN navy ships was from <a1_0>magnetic mines<a1_0/>. During the war, five U.S. Navy ships were lost to mines: two minesweepers, two minesweeper escorts, and one ocean tug. Mines and gunfire from North Korean coastal artillery damaged another <a2_0>87<a2_0/> U.S. warships, resulting in slight to moderate damage.
